title: Florissant Fossil Beds National Monument: Fossil vertebrates
body: Fossil Vertebrates           Pirate Perch Department of Vertebrate Paleontology, American Museum of Natural History, Specimen AMNH-FF-18924A  Fish Fish are the most abundant of vertebrate fossils found at Florissant Fossil Beds.          Fossil shorebird skull Denver Museum of Nature and Science  Birds Fossil birds are rare at Florissant. The three species illustrated here have been found in the ancient lake beds.        Fossil skull from a small opossum National Museum of Natural History, USNM-11955  Mammals A small variety of mammals have been discovered at Florissant Fossil Beds.
